Sentencas: The operation of solid oxide fuel cells with the use of different types of carbon-based fuels (i.e. natural gas, coal gas, etc.) became one of the main topics of SOFC research within the last years, Fuel gases like methane can be steam-reformed or partially oxidized within the SOFC stack, Usually a large amount of steam or air (steam to carbon ratio>2) has to be applied to avoid carbon deposition resulting in a degradation of the anode and a failure of the stack.
Titulo: Oxidation of H2, CO and methane in SOFCs with Ni/YSZ-cermet anodes

Sentencas: The influence of the steam to carbon ratio on the performance of planar state of the ail SOFC single cells with conventional nickel/yttria-stabilized zirconia cermet anodes has been investigated using CO/H-2 mixtures as well as CH4/H2O mixtures as fuel gas.
Titulo: Oxidation of H2, CO and methane in SOFCs with Ni/YSZ-cermet anodes

Sentencas: The cells were characterized by dc techniques and impedance spectroscopy under realistic working conditions.
Titulo: Oxidation of H2, CO and methane in SOFCs with Ni/YSZ-cermet anodes

Sentencas: In the case of CO/H-2 mixtures, a decrease in performance was observed at high CO portions (>90%), whereas the cell performance increased with decreasing S/C ratio using methane as the fuel.
Titulo: Oxidation of H2, CO and methane in SOFCs with Ni/YSZ-cermet anodes

Sentencas: In addition, the stability of single cells was investigated.
Titulo: Oxidation of H2, CO and methane in SOFCs with Ni/YSZ-cermet anodes

Sentencas: A stable operation using dry methane as fuel (S/C=0) was possible for up to 1000 h without serious degradation, (C) 2002
Titulo: Oxidation of H2, CO and methane in SOFCs with Ni/YSZ-cermet anodes
